description: Facing urgent BCI failures, Oksana Lintz decides to deploy an emergency patch to restore scoring workflows, despite noticing incomplete security checks in the code.
Shortly after the emergency patch is implemented, unusual access logs and data transfer spikes appear in secondary analytic systems, raising quiet alarm among senior technicians.
A city-wide breach exposes thousands of BCI score histories and personal data of residents and officials. Outrage spreads as leaked risk indicators are shared on social media.
The Council holds an emergency closed-door session. Directorate pushes for immediate information blackouts and tighter monitoring; Harmonists argue for transparency to restore public trust.
Demonstrations erupt as affected residents protest perceived character assassinations and job restrictions tied to the BCI leak. Public trust in the Council and system rapidly deteriorates.
